scope: Provision of legal advice, formulation of legislation and provision of legal aid services. Also includes responsibility and protection of the civil and consumer rights of individuals. USE Justice Administration for the Commonwealth Law Court System and USE Law Enforcement for policing functions
name: ADMINISTRATIVE LAW

scope: Functions relating to the provision of services to the Commonwealth Government and general public, including leasing, purchasing, storage, protection of government and diplomatic buildings
name: ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES

scope: Auditing and financial scrutiny of government operations, including departments, and autonomous or independent bodies
name: Audit

scope: Provision of secretariat services to Cabinet, Cabinet Committees and special wartime Cabinets
name: Cabinet

scope: Independent investigations and reviews established for specific purposes and abolished on completion of their tasks
name: Committees of Inquiry

scope: Electronic and print media and publishing, postal or telecommunications operations of the government (eg Australia Post). Also includes operation of government broadcasting stations and regulation of the broadcasting industry
name: COMMUNICATIONS

scope: Government involvement in the management, operation and support for the arts and cultural organisations such as museums, libraries and art galleries
name: CULTURAL AFFAIRS

scope: Administration and development of defence policy in time of peace or war. Includes military protection of Australia and the coordination of natural disaster services, the management of the defence industries infrastructure, defence scientific research and the collection of information of a strategic nature
name: DEFENCE

scope: Commonwealth area of responsibility for education, including scholarships, programs to assist students, particularly through grants to individuals, educational institutions and curriculum development. For scholarships to overseas students studying in Australia USE Overseas aid programs
name: EDUCATION

scope: Federal referendums and elections covering Parliament, unions and other bodies
name: Electoral matters

scope: Policy, development and research into the natural environment and the national estate, including world heritage concerns. For industries impacting on the environment USE Primary industries OR Secondary industries
name: ENVIRONMENT

scope: Determination of public policy on and regulation of taxation, supera-+nnuation, and the corporate and banking sectors; regulation of foreign investment and exchange issues. Also includes determination of Commonwealth funds to the States and Territories
name: FINANCIAL MATTERS

scope: Development of international relations, including the United Nations; diplomatic representation in overseas countries, including trade and immigration. Also includes implementation of aid programs for other countries
name: FOREIGN POLICY

scope: Representation of the Monarchy in Australia, involvement in Royal visits. For vice regal involvement in other ceremonial activities USE Ceremonial functions
name: Governor-General

scope: Public health, including quarantine and health research, except medical insurance and health benefit schemes. For insurance and benefit schemes USE Health insurance
name: HEALTH

scope: Health and welfare of indigenous peoples; includes social and political affairs and the provision of incentives for economic development
name: INDIGENOUS AFFAIRS

scope: Government involvement in the labour market; training and employment and national service; regulation and arbitration of working conditions and practices including promotion of safe working environments. For postwar reconstruction training schemes USE Repatriation
name: INDUSTRIAL RELATIONS

scope: Carriage of the Commonwealth justice system, including management and operation of judicial institutions
name: JUSTICE ADMINISTRATION

scope: Administration of policing function of Federal and former territory jurisdiction and research into law enforcement patterns and trends. Also covers protection of diplomatic missions and corrective services
name: LAW ENFORCEMENT

scope: Design, negotiations for, construction and maintenance of memorials and monuments
name: MEMORIALS

scope: Development and implementation of immigration and multicultural programs, including migrant accommodation, refugees, and recognition of overseas qualifications
name: MIGRATION

scope: Planning, funding or coordination of events or festivals designed to commemorate significant events related to the history and development of Australia
name: National events

scope: Execution of the parliamentary process in the House of Representatives and the Senate. Includes the Committees of House of Representatives, Senate and Joint House, and the provision of services to the Parliament
name: PARLIAMENTARY MATTERS

scope: Primary industries, except mining. For animal and plant quarantine USE Quarantine
name: PRIMARY INDUSTRIES

scope: Operational activities of the Australian Public Service, including working conditions and conditions of service
name: PUBLIC SERVICE

scope: Development and promotion of tourism, national fitness, sports and other recreational activities, such as parks
name: RECREATION

scope: Development and regulation of resource-related industries. Includes control over practices and research into renewable energy sources. For impact of resource extraction on the natural environment USE THE TERM ENVIRONMENT
name: RESOURCES

scope: Investigations conducted under the provisions of the Royal Commissions Act
name: Royal Commissions

scope: Development and promotion of science research and standards, land and sea survey and mapping, management of science programs including meteorology and space science
name: SCIENCE

scope: Government factories and Commonwealth involvement in the manufacturing sector (not related to Defence). Includes textiles, motor vehicles, electronics and consumer durables
name: Secondary industries

scope: Covers the activities of the Australian intelligence community. Includes information and advice affecting Australias internal security, defences, diplomacy, and international relations
name: SECURITY AND INTELLIGENCE

scope: Development and implementation of demographic surveys, census and provision of statistical information
name: Social and economic research

scope: Provision of community and welfare services, administration of pensions and allowances, and regulation of health insurance industry including government health-related subsidies
name: SOCIAL WELFARE

scope: All activities relating to mainland and external territories including the national capital. Also includes claims for compensation for land degradation. For administration of colonies USE Colonial Administration
name: TERRITORY ADMINISTRATION

scope: Exports and imports of resources and manufactured goods. Regulation of industry protection and subsidy schemes and control of imports through customs services
name: TRADE

scope: Public and private transport but excluding infrastructure activity such as road building. Also includes management of transport facilities such as lighthouses and airports
name: TRANSPORT

scope: Support for war veterans and their dependents, including determination of eligibility, provision of hospitals and geriatric care facilities
name: VETERANS AFFAIRS

scope: Determination of Government policy on construction and infrastructure projects including railways, housing and offices. Also includes provision of municipal services to mainland territories and development of programs to foster urban and regional development
name: WORKS
